Sentence.sentence: Workers' advocates have criticized Haslam's plan, saying it would mean some campus workers would lose their jobs or benefits.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They gradually lose the habit of migrating in winterThey prefer rubbish dumps far away to those at home.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: He had lost confidence in the Tennessee state government.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The US has already lost more than a third of the native languages that existed before European colonisation, and the remaining 192 are classed by UNESCO as ranging between unsafe and extinct.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Gregg Rosen lost his job as a sales  nearly three years ago and is still unemployed.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: They may lose the respect of patients.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: He said doctors risked losing the trust of patients if they told patients, I'm not going to do what I think is best for you because 1 think it's bad for the healthcare budget in Massachusetts.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: At the end of his first year, Nijay lost his Pell Grant of over $5,000 after narrowly missing the 2.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: American higher education has lost its global competitiveness.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Some of the heat is used directly or produces useful work; the rest is lost or rejected, radiated into the atmosphere from the engines, motors, boilers and all the energy-consuming machinery that makes American’s wheel go around.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I see now it's a huge pity that they rejected your request, but don't lose hope.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: If Apple alters the security model of future iPhones so that even its own engineers' "reasonable assistance" will not be able to crack a given device when compelled by the government, a precedent set in this case might lose its lasting force.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: It seems to be a law in the technology industry that leading companies eventually lose their positions, often quickly and brutally .
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Pasta is no longer off the menu, after a new review of studies suggested that the carbohydrate can form part of a healthy diet, and even help people lose weight.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Researchers at small labs or at institutions focused on teaching arguably have the most to lose when sharing hard-won data.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: So I've got nothing to lose.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Starr recently conducted a small study that found that adding extra protein foods to the diet of obese older individuals who were trying to lose weight strengthened their muscles.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Still, if late sleepers want to lose a few pounds, they can go to bed earlier than they usually do, thereby reducing their chances of taking snacks before bedtime.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第二套）听力  Section B

Sentence.sentence: The more you lose, the more open water is created, the more warming goes on in that open water during the summer, the less ice forms in the winter, the more melt there is the following summer.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: We can't really lose heat by breathing quickly and loudly like dogs.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"丢失，遗失"之意。
means: lose ： 最普通用词，侧重遗失了，难以找回来。
miss ： 着重发觉某人或某物不见的瞬间，也可作思念解。
misplace ： 指反映东西放错或故意放错地方。

Sentence.sentence: A year later, I reached my goal: I lost 150 pounds and raised $50,000! I feel that I've been given a second life to devote to something that is meaningful and enormous.

被打败；输掉（比赛、诉讼案件、辩论等）
（使）失去（所需要的东西，尤指钱）

data.mean: （因事故、年老、死亡等）损失，丧失，失去
（使）失去（所需要的东西，尤指钱）
被打败；输掉（比赛、诉讼案件、辩论等）

sentence.cn: 一位当地农民告诉他们，这条狗听起来就像是当地报纸上说的那只走失狗。
sentence.en: A local farmer told them the dog sounded like one  advertised as lost in the local paper.
sentence.from: 2019年高考英语全国卷2 完形填空 原文

sentence.en: Most of his adult life has been a losing struggle against debt and misfortune.

mean.mean: （因事故、年老、死亡等）损失，丧失，失去

jx.jx_en_mean: To fail to achieve or receive an expected gain.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 输掉，失败：未能达到或收到预定的目的

jx.jx_en_mean: be in a situation that is so bad that even if an action or undertaking is unsuccessful it cannot make it any worse
come to be less highly respected

lj.lj_ly: he was trying to work out how he could go back home without losing face.
lj.lj_ls: 他在设法找出不失面子回家的办法。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of an aircraft) descend to a lower level in flight

lj.lj_ly: no one is losing any sleep over what he thinks of us.
lj.lj_ls: 没人在意他怎样看我们。

jx.jx_en_mean: become lost; fail to reach one's destination
used to express the conviction that someone must inevitably profit from an action or undertaking

lj.lj_ly: we're offering them for only £2.50—you can't lose!.
lj.lj_ls: 我们以 2.5英镑的价格提供商品，包你得益！。

jx.jx_en_mean: To operate too slowly. Used of a timepiece.
jx.jx_cn_mean: （钟表）走慢：运转得太慢。用于计时器

entry.def: If you lose a contest, a fight, or an argument, you do not succeed because someone does better than you and defeats you.

example.ex: A C Milan lost the Italian Cup Final...
example.tran: AC米兰队输掉了意大利杯决赛。

example.ex: The government lost the argument over the pace of reform...
example.tran: 政府在有关改革步调快慢的争论中是输家。

entry.def: If you lose something, you do not know where it is, for example because you have forgotten where you put it.

example.ex: I lost my keys...
example.tran: 我把钥匙丢了。

example.ex: I had to go back for my checkup; they'd lost my X-rays.
example.tran: 我得回去再做一次体检。他们把我的X光片弄丢了。

entry.def: You say that you lose something when you no longer have it because it has been taken away from you or destroyed.
entry.tran: （因被夺走或遭损坏而）丧失，失去

example.ex: I lost my job when the company moved to another state...
example.tran: 公司搬到了另一个州，我便失业了。

example.ex: He lost his licence for six months...
example.tran: 他被吊销执照半年。

entry.def: If someone loses a quality, characteristic, attitude, or belief, they no longer have it.
entry.tran: 丧失，失去（某一特性、特点、态度或信念）

example.ex: He lost all sense of reason...
example.tran: 他完全丧失了理智。

example.ex: The government had lost all credibility...
example.tran: 政府的诚信丧失殆尽。

entry.def: If you lose an ability, you stop having that ability because of something such as an accident.
entry.tran: （因意外等）丧失，失去（某种能力）

example.ex: They lost their ability to hear...
example.tran: 他们失去了听觉。

example.ex: He had lost the use of his legs.
example.tran: 他双腿的功能已经丧失。

entry.def: If someone or something loses heat, their temperature becomes lower.

example.ex: Babies lose heat much faster than adults...
example.tran: 婴儿散失热量较成人快很多。

example.ex: A lot of body heat is lost through the scalp.
example.tran: 大量体热通过头皮散失。

entry.def: If you lose blood or fluid from your body, it leaves your body so that you have less of it.

example.ex: The victim suffered a dreadful injury and lost a lot of blood...
example.tran: 受害者受了重伤，大量失血。

example.ex: During fever a large quantity of fluid is lost in perspiration.
example.tran: 发烧时，大量水分会通过排汗而丧失。

entry.def: If you lose weight, you become less heavy, and usually look thinner.

example.ex: I have lost a lot of weight...
example.tran: 我体重减了不少。

example.ex: Martha was able to lose 25 pounds.
example.tran: 玛莎减掉了25磅。

entry.def: If you lose a part of your body, it is cut off in an operation or in an accident.
entry.tran: （因手术或意外）丧失，失去（身体部位）

example.ex: He lost a foot when he was struck by a train.
example.tran: 他给火车撞伤，失去了一只脚。

entry.def: If someone loses their life, they die.

example.ex: ...the ferry disaster in 1987, in which 192 people lost their lives...
example.tran: 1987年那场致使192人丧命的渡轮灾难

example.ex: Hundreds of lives were lost in fighting.
example.tran: 数以百计的人在战斗中丧生。

entry.def: If you lose a close relative or friend, they die.

example.ex: My Grandma lost her brother in the war.
example.tran: 我祖母在那场战争中失去了兄弟。

entry.def: If things are lost, they are destroyed in a disaster.

example.ex: ...the famous Nankin pottery that was lost in a shipwreck off the coast of China.
example.tran: 在中国沿海的一场海难中损毁的著名白底青花瓷

entry.def: If you lose time, something slows you down so that you do not make as much progress as you hoped.

example.ex: They claim that police lost valuable time in the early part of the investigation...
example.tran: 他们声称警方在调查之初错过了宝贵的时间。

example.ex: Six hours were lost in all.
example.tran: 一共浪费了6个小时。

entry.def: If you lose an opportunity, you do not take advantage of it.

example.ex: If you don't do it soon you're going to lose the opportunity...
example.tran: 不赶紧行动就没机会了。

example.ex: They did not lose the opportunity to say what they thought of events.
example.tran: 他们不失时机地表达了自己对事件的看法。

entry.def: If you lose yourself in something or if you are lost in it, you give a lot of attention to it and do not think about anything else.

example.ex: Michael held on to her arm, losing himself in the music...
example.tran: 迈克尔抓着她的手臂，沉醉于音乐中。

example.ex: He was lost in the contemplation of the landscape.
example.tran: 他对着眼前的景色沉思起来。

entry.def: If a business loses money, it earns less money than it spends, and is therefore in debt.

example.ex: His shops stand to lose millions of pounds...
example.tran: 他的店铺很可能会损失数百万英镑。

example.ex: $1 billion a year may be lost.
example.tran: 每年可能损失10亿美元。

entry.def: If something loses you a contest or loses you something that you had, it causes you to fail or to no longer have what you had.

example.ex: My own stupidity lost me the match...
example.tran: 是我自己的愚蠢使我输掉了那场比赛。

example.ex: His economic mismanagement has lost him the support of the general public.
example.tran: 他对经济的管理不善使他失去了广大民众的支持。

entry.def: If you say that you have nothing to lose, you mean that you will not suffer if your action is unsuccessful. If you say that you have much to lose, you mean that you may suffer if your action is unsuccessful.
entry.tran: （表示在不成功的情况下）不会损失什么/将会损失惨重

example.ex: They say they have nothing to lose and will continue protesting until the government vetos the agreement...
example.tran: 他们说自己是死猪不怕开水烫，将会继续抗议直到政府否决该协议为止。

example.ex: Both countries have much to lose if there is a war.
example.tran: 若战事一起，两国均会损失惨重。

entry.def: If someone loses it, they become extremely angry or upset.
entry.tran: 大发雷霆；未能控制怒火（或情绪）

example.ex: I completely lost it. I went mad, berserk.
example.tran: 我火冒三丈，发了疯似的。

entry.def: If you say that someone is losing it, you mean that they are becoming crazy.

example.ex: I'm afraid he's really lost it.
example.tran: 我想他是真的发疯了。

entry.def: If you say that someone loses no opportunity to do or say a particular thing, you are emphasizing that they do it or say it whenever it is possible.

example.ex: The President has lost no opportunity to capitalise on his new position...
example.tran: 总统抓住一切机会，大肆利用自己的新职位。

example.ex: He said some sections of the press had lost no opportunity to create the impression that she was guilty.
example.tran: 他说新闻界有部分人不放过任何机会，力图制造她有罪的印象。

entry.def: If you say that someone loses no time in doing something, you are emphasizing that they act quickly in order to benefit from a situation.

example.ex: Officials have lost no time in expressing their concern and grief over this incident...
example.tran: 众官员第一时间表达了他们对这一事件的关切和悲伤。

example.ex: Francine lost no time in defending herself.
example.tran: 弗朗辛立即为自己辩护。

entry.def: If you lose your way, you become lost when you are trying to go somewhere.

example.ex: The men lost their way in a sandstorm.
example.tran: 这些士兵在沙暴中迷了路。

entry.def: If you say that someone loses their way, you think they no longer have a clear idea of what they want to do or achieve.

example.ex: For a while the artist completely lost his way. The famous humour gave way to sentimental nonsense...
example.tran: 有一阵子这位艺术家完全迷失了方向，其出了名的幽默风趣被伤感而煽情的不知所云取而代之。

example.ex: If we cannot understand that there's an issue of principle here, then we have lost our way.
example.tran: 如果我们看不到这里的原则问题的话，那么我们已经迷失方向了。

means.word_mean: 1. fail to keep or to maintain; cease to have, either physically or in an abstract sense;

sentences.sentence: "She lost her purse when she left it unattended on her seat"
"We lost the battle but we won the war"

means.word_mean: 3. suffer the loss of a person through death or removal;

sentences.sentence: "She lost her husband in the war"
"The couple that wanted to adopt the child lost her when the biological parents claimed her"

means.word_mean: 4. place (something) where one cannot find it again;
5. miss from one's possessions; lose sight of;
6. allow to go out of sight;

sentences.sentence: "The detective lost the man he was shadowing after he had to stop at a red light"

means.word_mean: 7. fail to make money in a business; make a loss or fail to profit;

sentences.sentence: "I lost thousands of dollars on that bad investment!"
"The company turned a loss after the first year"
"I lost the opportunity to spend a year abroad"

means.word_mean: 10. fail to perceive or to catch with the senses or the mind;

sentences.sentence: "We lost part of what he said"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English losian 'perish, destroy', also 'become unable to find', from los 'loss'

sentences.en: He was taken to the refuge for lost children.

sentences.en: The precious moments all are lost in the tide . yea.

sentences.en: If lost, the holder should report to the issuing authority immediately.

sentences.en: She lost her purse.

sentences.cn: 保管好存折,遗失请告诉咱们.
sentences.en: Keep it well and inform us when ot happen before you lose it.

sentences.cn: 遗失的单纯, 在上一个转弯的路口是否能捡回?
sentences.en: The lost innocence, can it be retrieved at the last turning point?

sentences.en: I saw I must lose no time if I were to find the boat that evening.

sentences.cn: 一分钟也不能耽搁.
sentences.en: Not a single minute is to be lost.

sentences.cn: 于是她极其诚恳地请求他马上就回家去写,不要耽搁.
sentences.en: Most earnestly did she then entreat him to lose no more time before he wrote.

sentences.en: He lost his way, which delayed him considerably.

sentences.cn: 真是痛得难受,不过没有关系, 我一会儿也不能耽搁.
sentences.en: The pain was cruel but, no matter, I must not lose any time.

sentences.cn: 干吧, 时间不能耽搁了.
sentences.en: Come, there is no time to lose.

sentences.cn: 你耽搁了整整半天的活.
sentences.en: You've lost a whole halfday's work.

sentences.cn: 一秒钟也不能耽搁了.
sentences.en: There is not a second to be lost.

sentences.cn: 路易丝没有耽搁,马上回到辛辛那提.
sentences.en: Louise lost no time in returning to Cincinnati.

sentences.cn: 如果我耽搁了,成功便会投入别人的怀抱,我会永远失去她.
sentences.en: If I delay she will betrothed to another and lost to me forever.

sentences.cn: 有一些家庭的财产在洪水中损失得精光。
sentences.en: Some families lost everything (= all they owned) in the flood.

sentences.cn: 他的店铺很可能会损失数百万英镑。
sentences.en: His shops stand to lose millions of pounds...

sentences.cn: 每年可能损失10亿美元。
sentences.en: $1 billion a year may be lost.

sentences.cn: 若战事一起，两国均会损失惨重。
sentences.en: Both countries have much to lose if there is a war.

sentences.cn: 安特吉公司似平已经认识到，既然它在佛蒙特州已经名誉扫地，那么和州政府再打一场官司也不会造成更大损失。
sentences.en: The company seems to have concluded that its reputation in Vermont is already so damaged that it has noting left to lose by going to war with the state.

sentences.cn: 为了实行这项方案，政府必须 工资补贴来弥补由于工作时间缩短而损失的工资。
sentences.en: For this scheme to work, the government must provide wage subsidies to compensate for lost pay due to the shorter hours.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 农 场损失了约250万只蜜蜂。
sentences.en: The farm lost about 5 million bees
sentences.from: 18年6月四级真题(第二套)| 听力

sentences.cn: 我们应该努力工作弥补损失的时间.
sentences.en: We should work hard to recover the lost time.

sentences.cn: 我们生产队在洪水中损失了差不多五十头牛.
sentences.en: Our production brigade lost nearly fifty cattle in the flood.

sentences.cn: 反正报价不要钱, 您没有损失.
sentences.en: Bids are free, so you lave nothing to lose.

sentences.cn: 我们确实不会有任何损失.
sentences.en: Really we have nothing to lose.

sentences.cn: 堤坝渗漏破坏给国民经济带来了巨大的损失.
sentences.en: It has get a huge loses to national economy because of seepage failure.

sentences.cn: 花点时间是不会使任何有价值的东西遭到损失的.
sentences.en: Nothing valuable can be lost by taking time.

sentences.cn: 为什么他在他的对手面前损失这么多时间?
sentences.en: Why is he losing so much time to his rival?

sentences.cn: 美军战地指挥官报告损失了2辆坦克和多达5辆装甲运兵车.
sentences.en: The US field commanders reported 2 lost tanks and up to 5 lost APCs.

sentences.cn: 你怎样说明为什么损失了这么大一笔钱?
sentences.en: How do you account for losing such a large sum of money?

sentences.cn: 一旦无力偿债银行的无担保债权人真的遭受损失, 市场纪律就将重返整个行业.
sentences.en: Once unsecured debtholders of insolvent banks lose, market discipline would return to the whole sector.

sentences.cn: 你是不是因此受到损失 呢 ?
sentences.en: Did you lose by it?

sentences.cn: 按我们的储蓄计划把钱存起来, 你就不会蒙受什么损失.
sentences.en: Put your money into our savings plan, and you can't lose by it.

sentences.cn: 他尽力弥补他的损失.
sentences.en: He leans over backwards to make up for what he has lost.

sentences.cn: 日冕总是不断地获得能量和损失能量.
sentences.en: The corona gains and loses energy continuously.

sentences.cn: 银行的投资便要损失相当大的比例.
sentences.en: The bans would lose a significant percentage of their investment.

sentences.cn: 体温下降发生于身体无法提供足以补充损失的热量.
sentences.en: Hypothermia happens when the body cannot produce as heat as it loses.

sentences.cn: 保险金将弥补损失的收入.
sentences.en: The insurance will replace the lost income.

sentences.cn: 多国部队损失的飞机是他们自己引起事故造成的.
sentences.en: The lost aircraft of the Allied Forces were due to their own accidents.

sentences.cn: 至少我们没有损失什么钱. 这还算幸运.
sentences.en: At least we didn't lose any money. That's something.

sentences.cn: 他损失了很多钱.
sentences.en: He'l lost a lot of money.

sentences.cn: 实际上,俄国损失无几.
sentences.en: In practical terms Russia will lose little.

sentences.cn: 如果吉姆考试失败的话, 他将遭到惨重损失.
sentences.en: Jim might fail the test; in that event, he would lose a great deal.

sentences.cn: 输掉比赛 / 赛跑 / 选举 / 战役 / 战争
sentences.en: to lose a game/a race/an election/a battle/a war

sentences.cn: AC米兰队输掉了意大利杯决赛。
sentences.en: A C Milan lost the Italian Cup Final...

sentences.cn: 是我自己的愚蠢使我输掉了那场比赛。
sentences.en: My own stupidity lost me the match...

sentences.cn: 预计该趋势还将继续收紧。专家表示，无论苹果公司是否会输掉这起官司，其未来采取的举措几乎肯定会进一步限制政府的影响范围。
sentences.en: K) You can expect that noose to continue to tighten. Experts said that whether or not Apple loses this specific case, measures that it could put into place in the future will almost certainly be able to further limit the government's reach.
sentences.from: 17年12月六级真题(第三套)| 阅读

sentences.cn: 主队输掉了比赛,令球迷们大失所望.
sentences.en: Fans were so disappointed when their home team lost the game.

sentences.cn: 实际上,我们可以赢得或输掉辩论.
sentences.en: We can actually win or lose arguments.

sentences.cn: 但即使我们在这里输球,我的球队将永远不会输掉他们的信心和士气.
sentences.en: But my team would never lose their confidence or mentality just because of a defeat here.

sentences.cn: 要不是你们的帮助, 我们会输掉这场比赛的.
sentences.en: But for your help, we would have lost the game.

sentences.cn: 输掉比赛后,她丧失了信心.
sentences.en: She lost heart after losing the game.

sentences.cn: 蒂娜输掉这场长跑比赛也有好处,因为这会使她更加努力练习.
sentences.en: Tina's losing the long distance race was actually salutary because it made her practice harder.

sentences.cn: 我在股市输掉了全部财产.
sentences.en: I lost my shirt in the stock market.

sentences.cn: 英格兰队再不改进打法, 就会输掉这场比赛.
sentences.en: Unless the team of England improves its game, it's going to lose the match.

sentences.cn: 由于输掉比赛,整队都陷入困境.
sentences.en: The whole team was in the doghouse because they lost the game.

sentences.cn: 我们想在场上表现得更好, 我们不想输掉任何一场比赛.
sentences.en: We want to better performance in the field, we do not want to lose any game.

sentences.cn: 他赌输掉所有的筹码.
sentences.en: He has lost all his chips.

sentences.cn: 而她输掉赌局又怎能说是我的过错?
sentences.en: How could that be my fault when she gambled and lost?

sentences.cn: 我的马在比赛中以一步之差输掉了.
sentences.en: My horse lost the race by a nose.

sentences.cn: 冠军打得很糟,输掉了那场网球赛.
sentences.en: The champion blew up and lost the tennis match.

sentences.cn: 我将不必因为一包坏运气的游戏卡而输掉这个游戏.
sentences.en: I will not necessarily lose the game with a pack of playing cards of bad luck.

sentences.cn: 我们输掉了战斗却赢得了战争.
sentences.en: We lost the battle but we won the war.

sentences.cn: 正常来说我们应该输掉这场比赛,然后觉醒.
sentences.en: Normally you lose matches to wake up.

sentences.cn: 你决不能因为我的缘故而输掉这场比赛,还要败坏这条好船的名誉.
sentences.en: You shall not lose your race and the reputation of your fine boat because of me.

sentences.cn: 你在赌马时,常常输掉.
sentences.en: You often lose out when you bet on horse races.

sentences.cn: 我以为主队要输掉那场比赛.
sentences.en: I thought the local teams were going to lose.

sentences.cn: 他划桨时失手,输掉了比赛.
sentences.en: He caught a crab and lost the race.

sentences.cn: 如果这个官司输掉了, 迈克将承担诉讼费用.
sentences.en: If he loses the case , Michael will have pick up the bill for legal costs.

sentences.cn: 那个队因没有出席而输掉比赛.
sentences.en: The team lost a game by default.

sentences.cn: 下半场, 我们错漏百出,输得很惨,最后六比一输掉比赛.
sentences.en: The second half, lowell six ratios as soon as lose the competition.

sentences.cn: 1990年桑地诺同意举行大选, 却在选举中输掉了政权.
sentences.en: In 1990 the Sandinistas agreed to hold free elections, which they lost.

sentences.cn: 如果他们再多输掉一场比赛, 联赛冠军对于他们来说就遥不可及了.
sentences.en: If they lose one more game, the league championship would be out reach for them.

sentences.cn: 你的表走慢了.
sentences.en: Your watch is losing.

sentences.cn: 鸿渐告诉她每点钟走慢七分钟的事实.
sentences.en: He then told her that it lost seven minutes every hour.

sentences.cn: 这只表一天走慢一个多小时.
sentences.en: This watch loses more than one hour a day.

Sentence.sentence: Modern techniques for producing and shipping food led to greater variety and quantity, including a tremendous increase in the amount of animal protein and dairy products available, making us more vigorous than our ancestorsYet plenty has been lost too, even in cultures that still live to eat.

Sentence.sentence: Think of a 3-year-old lost in the pleasures of finding out what he can and cannot sink in the bathtub, a 5-year- old beside herself with the thrill of putting together strings of nonsensical words with her best friends, or an 11-year-old completely absorbed in a fascinating comic strip.

Sentence.sentence: If the most health-conscious among us have such deep swings in our shut-eye levels throughout the year, how much sleep are the rest of us losing? They are culture-related.

Sentence.sentence: From data collected, it seems the things that cause us to lose the most sleep, on average, are sporting events, time changes, and holidays.

Sentence.sentence: Got a smart phone? Never lose your hotel key, or even have to stop at the registration desk again.

Sentence.sentence: But steamships didn't lose their sails until the 1880s, because early marine engines had a nasty habit of breaking down.

Sentence.sentence: At their best, they are works of art and there is a tactile（触觉的）pleasure in books necessarily lost in e-book versions.

Sentence.sentence: The ability to quickly thumb through pages is also lost

Sentence.sentence: In fact, when you break a role or law, you lose control over your life and give others the power to impose punishment that you have no control over.

Sentence.sentence: may lose everything in the end

Sentence.sentence: Many Americans lost faith in the integrity of their political leaders as a result of the Watergate scandal.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: I have no money or insurance to get professional help; I can't even pay my mortgage (抵押贷款) and face losing everything.

Sentence.sentence: And it would take an average of 65 years for the reduced carbon emissions from a new energy-efficient home to make up for the resources lost by destroying an old one.

Sentence.sentence: Once she lost a two-cent stamp and spent the night looking for it.

Sentence.sentence: It has been losing market share in recent years.

Sentence.sentence: The editor is frightened by this news, but he is more frightened by the idea of losing his newspaper, so he agrees to sign
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Customers losing all sense of time.

Sentence.sentence: This place doesn't look familiar at all, we must be lost.

Sentence.sentence: Jane, suppose you lost all your money while taking a vacation overseas, what would you do?
